questions.question: What is the capital of France?
What is the largest planet in our solar system?
What is the population of New York City?
How many kilometers is the Great Wall of China?
What year was the first iPhone released?
How many bones are in the human body?
What is the height of Mount Everest in meters?

trueStatements: It is a planet in our solar system.
It is known as the Red Planet.
It has two moons named Phobos and Deimos.
questions.wrongStatement: It is the largest planet in our solar system.

trueStatements: It is used for web development.
It was created by Brendan Eich.
questions.wrongStatement: It is a type of database.

trueStatements: It is known for its high potassium content.
questions.wrongStatement: It is a type of citrus fruit.

trueStatements: It is a famous landmark in Paris.
It is named after its engineer, Gustave Eiffel.
questions.wrongStatement: It is the tallest building in the world.

trueStatements: It is a type of animal.
It is known for its ability to change color.
questions.wrongStatement: It is a type of bird.

questions.statement: Cows can walk upstairs but not downstairs.
questions.description: Fact: They cannot properly bend their front knees, making it difficult to walk downstairs.

questions.statement: The Great Wall of China is visible from space with the naked eye.
questions.description: Fake: It is long but too narrow to be seen without aid.

questions.statement: Earthworms can be cut in half and both halves will survive.
questions.description: Fake: Only the part with vital organs survives; the other part dies.

questions.statement: A human heart beats about 3 billion times in a lifetime.
questions.description: Fact: This is true for an average lifespan and resting heart rate.

questions.statement: The first car was powered by electric motors.
questions.description: Fact: Early cars had electric motors before gasoline engines became popular.

questions.statement: The light bulb was invented by Thomas Edison.
questions.description: Fake: Edison greatly improved the light bulb, but it was invented earlier.

questions.statement: Lightning never strikes the same place twice.
questions.description: Fake: Lightning can strike the same place multiple times.
